body_html:
@arixlin I have tried setting reuse=True, but another error occurs.
The two models have both same and different named variables, so if set reuse=True, there are some variables does not pre-defined, and it seems that the followed variables will override the afore-restored variables.
Now I just want to add prefix for all variables within a model.
For examples, there are exist
'conv1/weight' in A model
and
'conv1/weight' in B model,
I want to add prefix "model_A" and "model_B" for all variables in A and B separately
The previous variables now should be:
'model_A/conv1/weight' in model A
and
'model_B/conv1/weight' in model B

body:
@arixlin I have tried setting reuse=True, but another error occurs.
The two models have both same and different named variables, so if set reuse=True, there are some variables does not pre-defined, and it seems that the followed variables will override the afore-restored variables.
Now I just want to add prefix for all variables within a model.
For examples, there are exist
'conv1/weight' in A model
and
'conv1/weight' in B model,
I want to add prefix "model_A" and "model_B" for all variables in A and B separately
The previous variables now should be:
'model_A/conv1/weight' in model A
and
'model_B/conv1/weight' in model B
